eeguana 0.0.2.9000

    • Manipulating a clean EEG file exported from BrainVision 2.0
  • Changelog

Reference

About

eeguana

eeguana: A package for flexible manipulation of EEG data.

Reading functions

Functions for reading external files (BrainVision and mat files from Fieldtrip) and return an eeg_lst. (Upcoming: eeglab and edf files).

read_ft()

Read a Fieldtrip file into an eeg_lst object (requires R.matlab).

read_vhdr()

Read a BrainVision file into an eeg_lst object.

Tidyverse 'dplyr'(-like) functions

Functions that overload some dplyr functions and always return an eeg_lst.

mutate(<eeg_lst>) transmute(<eeg_lst>) summarise(<eeg_lst>) tbl_vars(<eeg_lst>) groups(<eeg_lst>) group_by(<eeg_lst>) ungroup(<eeg_lst>) group_vars(<eeg_lst>) filter(<eeg_lst>) select(<eeg_lst>) rename(<eeg_lst>) left_join(<eeg_lst>) semi_join(<eeg_lst>) anti_join(<eeg_lst>)

Dplyr functions for eeg_lst objects.

bind()

Bind eeg_lst objects.

Specialized summarizing functions

Functions that apply a series of dplyr functions to return useful summaries.

summarize_by_id_tbl()

Convert an eeg_lst into a summary long-data frame based on a statistics.

count_complete_cases_tbl()

Count number of complete segments of an eeg_lst object.

Channel functions

Functions that act on the channels of the signal table. They have a default version that acts on all the channels, and can be used inside a mutate call for more control. (Not all of them support both actions right now, but they will be implemented in the near future).

ch_baseline()

Baseline an eeg_lst

ch_rereference()

Rereference channel.

chs_mean()

Get the by-sample (or by-row) mean of the specified channels.

EEG-specialized functions

Functions for applying specialized actions on specific channels of the signal table or the entire eeg_lst. (I may add a prefix to the functions when I see that I can group them).

downsample()

Downsample EEG data

segment()

Segment an eeg_lst.

event_to_ch_NA()

Remove (transform to NA) problematic events from an eeg_lst.

Plot functions

Functions for doing data wrangling after summarizing or downsampling the signal to create a long table, and then wrap ggplot functions.

plot(<eeg_lst>)

Simple plot an eeg_lst object.

plot_gg()

ggplot object based on an eeg_lst object.

plot_topo()

A topographic plot of an eeg_lst object.

'base'-inspired functions

Functions for doing data wrangling after summarizing or downsampling the signal to create a long table, and then wrap ggplot functions.

as_sample_id()

Convert a time point into a sample point.

as_tibble(<eeg_lst>) as_data_frame(<eeg_lst>) as.tibble.eeg_lst()

Convert an eeg_lst to a tibble.

as_time()

Convert a sample point into a time point.

as.data.frame(<eeg_lst>)

Convert an eeg_lst to a (base) data frame.

is_channel_dbl()

Test if the object is a channel This function returns TRUE for channels.

is_eeg_lst()

Test if the object is an eeg_lst. This function returns TRUE for eeg_lsts.

is_sample_int()

Test if the object is a sample This function returns TRUE for samples.

is_signal_tbl()

Test if the object is a signal_tbl This function returns TRUE for signals.

channel_names(<eeg_lst>) nchannels(<eeg_lst>) channels_tbl(<eeg_lst>) `channels_tbl<-`(<eeg_lst>) nsamples(<eeg_lst>) summary(<eeg_lst>) print(<eeg_summary>)

Display information of the eeg_lst object.

event_to_ch_NA()

Remove (transform to NA) problematic events from an eeg_lst.

Constructor functions

Internal functions for creating objects.

eeg_lst()

Builds an eeg_lst.

sample_int()

Builds a serie of sample numbers.

channel_dbl()

Builds a channel.

signal_tbl()

Builds a signal_tbl table.
